                                    1099             =RM       REG   8        *    SCRATCH
                                    1111             =RN       REG   9        *    SCRATCH (In Guest)

                                    1147             =BRR      REG   11       -    SECOND BASE REGISTER

                                    1171             =SPR      REG   13       -    STACK TOP POINTER

                                    1211             =*        -     Register may not be used
                                    1212             =*        1     Available but may change on subroutine calls

1PAGESERV (PAGE00) (09:42) (22MAR04) MP-ORVYL Real Memory / Paging Manager Services                                         Page    6
0Loc    Object Code    Addr1 Addr2  Stmt Lv Lineno    Source Statement           (Hibal 5, Asmedit 3.3)  HLASM R4.0  2004/03/22 09.42

0                                   1291      27.     *  Notes on muliple faults in one AS:
                                    1292      28.     *    Need a PCB extension per task
                                    1293      29.     *    PIO completion must be signaled with a PID, not just an ASB
                                    1294      30.     *    Page fault resolve notes:
                                    1295      31.     *     BEFORE any routines that could wait (and release the local
                                    1296      32.     *        PAGING lock) the page fault routines must:
                                    1297      33.     *      set the real address of the frame in PGAD
                                    1298      34.     *        any subsequent faults seeing "fault handled" will use this
                                    1299      35.     *        real address to find the waiting PCB and queue itself up
                                    1300      36.     *      short term fixes for page table should be incremented
                                    1301      37.     *        if not incremented, then the page table could be trimmed
                                    1302      38.     *        from the working set if no pages were set as active in it
                                    1303      39.     *      flag set for page fault handled
                                    1304      40.     *  PAGESERV:
                                    1305      41.     *    PTLB considerations
                                    1306      42.     *     If a segment table is swapped out, and is then reused as
                                    1307      43.     *     a segment table for another address space on a CPU which
                                    1308      44.     *     hasn't purged its TLB, the DAT process could be in error.
                                    1309      45.     *  Optimizations:
                                    1310      46.     *    Could PAGWAIT use cell ECB for some waits & be task based?
                                    1311      47.     *    SWAP on pages
1PAGESERV (PAGE00) (09:42) (22MAR04) MP-ORVYL Real Memory / Paging Manager Services                                         Page    7
0Loc    Object Code    Addr1 Addr2  Stmt Lv Lineno    Source Statement           (Hibal 5, Asmedit 3.3)  HLASM R4.0  2004/03/22 09.42
+___    ______ ____    _____ _____  ____ __ ______    ______ _________
0                                   1313      49.     *                     PAGE/SEGMENT FAULT NOTES
                                    1314      50.     *
                                    1315      51.     *   When a page I/O is in progress, the page table entry is marked
                                    1316      52.     * as "in I/O", using one of the available software flags in the
                                    1317      53.     * page table entry (PGTFIO).
                                    1318      54.     *   When a segment I/O is in progress, the shadow segment table is
                                    1319      55.     * marked as "in I/O" using the SSTFIO flag.
                                    1320      56.     *   Page tables also have virtual addresses, and the page table entry
                                    1321      57.     * for a page table's virtual address is marked to show that this
                                    1322      58.     * is a page table page (PGTFPGT).
                                    1323      59.     *   If a page fault occurs on a page that is "in I/O", the page
                                    1324      60.     * table entry contains the frame address of the I/O.  The faulting
                                    1325      61.     * process should look in the page frame table for the I/O control
                                    1326      62.     * block, and queue itself up as a waiting process.
                                    1327      63.     *   Page faults on pages not "in I/O" are handled differently for
                                    1328      64.     * normal pages and page table pages.  For non page table pages
                                    1329      65.     * the shadow page table holds the external block number, the
                                    1330      66.     * page in is requested, and the page table entry is marked as
                                    1331      67.     * "in I/O".
                                    1332      68.     *   Page faults on page table pages (not "in I/O") have
                                    1333      69.     * to deal with fixing up segment table entries as well as page
                                    1334      70.     * table entries.  Because of this, when a page table is not
                                    1335      71.     * in main store, the frame address is set to the segment number
                                    1336      72.     * that this page table represents.  For example, the page table for
                                    1337      73.     * segment 5 will have a page table entry like X'005004xx'.  This
                                    1338      74.     * indicates an invalid page, but the software flag that says it's
                                    1339      75.     * a page table page indicates that the frame address is
                                    1340      76.     * significant.
                                    1341      77.     *   When a page table is not in core, the segment table entry is set
                                    1342      78.     * to the virtual address of the page table.  A segment fault uses
                                    1343      79.     * this address to set the page table entry as "in I/O", as well
                                    1344      80.     * as setting the
                                    1345      81.     *
                                    1346      82.     *                        SWAP flags and Frame counts
                                    1347      83.     *
                                    1348      84.     *  Each PCB has flags that indicate the swap in/out status of
                                    1349      85.     *  an address space, and whether it's frames have been reused
                                    1350      86.     *  after a swap out.
                                    1351      87.     *
                                    1352      88.     *    PCBFSOUT  indicates that the address space is considered
                                    1353      89.     *              swapped out by the dispatcher (and not requested
                                    1354      90.     *              to be brought back in)
                                    1355      91.     *    PCBFISOUT indicates that the address space is considered out
                                    1356      92.     *              by the paging/swapping manager
                                    1357      93.     *    PCBFRSIN  indicates that a swap-in was requested before
                                    1358      94.     *              the swap-out I/O completed, and the request
                                    1359      95.     *              will be handled at the swap-out I/O completion.
                                    1360      96.     *
                                    1361      97.     *    MATPAGFN  This number is managed by PAGESERV and looked at
                                    1362      98.     *              by DISPATCH.  The number is computed absolutely
                                    1363      99.     *              when an address space is sent out by the dispatcher
                                    1364     100.     *              (PAGOSWAP), and when a swap out segment finishes
                                    1365     101.     *              it's I/O (PAGOSEND).  Otherwise the MATPAGFN number
                                    1366     102.     *              is simply computed as a difference between its
                                    1367     103.     *              old value and a specific delta.
                                    1368     104.     *
1PAGESERV (PAGE00) (09:42) (22MAR04) MP-ORVYL Real Memory / Paging Manager Services                                         Page    8
0Loc    Object Code    Addr1 Addr2  Stmt Lv Lineno    Source Statement           (Hibal 5, Asmedit 3.3)  HLASM R4.0  2004/03/22 09.42
+___    ______ ____    _____ _____  ____ __ ______    ______ _________
0                                   1369     105.     *                        PAGESERV LOCK NOTES
                                    1370     106.     * 1) Local address space lock
                                    1371     107.     *    Location: PCBLOCK
                                    1372     108.     *    Prio:     This lock is usually the first to be obtained when
                                    1373     109.     *              doing management of an address space's real memory.
                                    1374     110.     *              If the global lock is to be held too, this lock must
                                    1375     111.     *              be obtained first.
                                    1376     112.     *    Use:      This lock serializes the manipulation of all segment
                                    1377     113.     *              and page tables (hardware and shadow) for the
                                    1378     114.     *              local section of this address space, and the
                                    1379     115.     *              manipulation of page frame table entries (PFTEs)
                                    1380     116.     *              that are linked on this PCB as used frames.
                                    1381     117.     *              Flags and other entries in the PCB are also
                                    1382     118.     *              serialized by this lock.  The exception is the flag
                                    1383     119.     *              for frames of a swapped address space.  This flag is
                                    1384     120.     *              governed by the Frames lock.
                                    1385     121.     * 2) Common address space lock
                                    1386     122.     *    Location: PCBLOCK in ASB pointed to by PAGCASB
                                    1387     123.     *    Prio:     If a local lock is to be held too, the local lock must
                                    1388     124.     *              be obtained first.
                                    1389     125.     *    Use:      This lock serializes the manipulation of all segment
                                    1390     126.     *              and page tables (hardware and shadow) for the common
                                    1391     127.     *              section of all address spaces, the manipulation of
                                    1392     128.     *              fields within the common PCB, and the manipulation of
                                    1393     129.     *              page frame table entries (PFTEs) that are linked on
                                    1394     130.     *              the ASB as used frames.
                                    1395     131.     * 3) Free frames lock
                                    1396     132.     *    Location: PAGFRAL
                                    1397     133.     *    Prio:     If this lock is to be held concurrently with another
                                    1398     134.     *              AS lock, the other AS lock must be held first, unless
                                    1399     135.     *              the AS lock is obtained for an AS being swapped in.
                                    1400     136.     *    Use:      This lock serializes the manipulation of the free
                                    1401     137.     *              frames pool.
                                    1402     138.     * 4) Swap control lock
                                    1403     139.     *    Location: PAGSWAPL
                                    1404     140.     *    Prio:     If this lock is to be held concurrently with another
                                    1405     141.     *              AS lock, the other AS lock must be held first.
                                    1406     142.     *    Use:      This lock serializes the manipulation of swapped out
                                    1407     143.     *              address spaces, and whether or not they own frames.
                                    1408     144.     *              This lock governs the swap flags in a
                                    1409     145.     *              PCB (PCBSFLG). This lock is used for manipulating the
                                    1410     146.     *              queues of swapped out address spaces and the frame
                                    1411     147.     *              counts represented by those queues.
                                    1412     148.     * 5) ASN maniuplation lock
                                    1413     149.     *    Location: PAGASNL
                                    1414     150.     *    Prio:     If this lock is to be held concurrently with another
                                    1415     151.     *              PAGESERV lock (PCBLOCK or otherwise) the other lock
                                    1416     152.     *              must be held first.
                                    1417     153.     *    Use:      This lock serializes the manipulation the ASN tables.

0                                   1419     155.              COPY  LISTPARM
                                    1420             =*   A list header block is used to control access to a chain
                                    1421             =* of resources.  All elements which are to be linked together on
                                    1422             =* these doubly linked circular lists must have the elements
                                    1423             =* first word be space for a forward list pointer, and the second
                                    1424             =* word space for a backward list pointer.
 000000                00000 0000C  1425             =LHEAD    RECORD BEGIN                  List descriptor
                                    1433  1          =           LHEAD PFX=LH
 000000                             1434  1 01-LHEAD +LHFP       DS    A                       Forward pointer
 000004                             1435  1 01-LHEAD +LHBP       DS    A                       Backward pointer
 000008                             1436  1 01-LHEAD +LHCNT      DS    A                       Number of elements in list
 00000C                0000C 0000C  1437             =         END   ,
0000000                00000 00008  1447             =LELEM    RECORD BEGIN                  Common start of list items
                                    1455  1          =           LELEM PFX=L
 000000                             1456  1 01-LELEM +LFP        DS    A                       Forward pointer
 000004                             1457  1 01-LELEM +LBP        DS    A                       Backward pointer
 000008                00008 00008  1458             =         END   ,
0000000                00000 00010  1468             =@LADD    RECORD BEGIN                  Add items to a list
 000000                             1476  1          =@LAHEAD    DS    A                       Header block of list
 000004                             1477  1          =@LA1ST     DS    A                       First item being added
 000008                             1478  1          =@LALAST    DS    A                       Last item being added
 00000C                             1479  1          =@LACNT     DS    A                       Number of items being added

 000000                             1498  1          =@LRHEAD    DS    A                       Header block of list
 000004                             1499  1          =@LR1ST     DS    A                       First item being removed
 000008                             1500  1          =@LRCNT     DS    A                       Number of items being removed
                                    1501  1          =* -- Return Parms --
 00000C                             1502  1          =@LRLAST    DS    A                       Last item removed

0                                   1513     157.              COPY  LSTMAC
                                    1514             =         PRINT OFF
                                    1558             =*********************************************************************
                                    1559             =*   Add elements to a list
                                    1560             =*
                                    1561             =*   Input
                                    1562             =*
                                    1563             =* &L  LADD     &HEAD,&FIRST,&FLAST,&FCOUNT,&WR=,&WR2=RAR,&WR3=EPAR
                                    1564             =*     &HEAD    is a pointer the head of the list (defop = LA)
                                    1565             =*     &FIRST   first element to be added to the list
                                    1566             =*     &FLAST   last element to be added (if not specified, assuming
                                    1567             =*              only one)
                                    1568             =*     &FCOUNT  count of elements being added (shouldn't be specified
                                    1569             =*              for only one add)
                                    1570             =*     &WR
                                    1571             =*     &WR2     Registers for scratch
                                    1572             =*     &WR3

                                    1676             =*

                                    1681             =*     &HEAD    is a pointer the head of the list (defop = LA)
                                    1682             =*     &FFIRST  first element to be removed from the list (if not
                                    1683             =*              specified then take the first on the list)
                                    1684             =*     &LAST    last element removed (must be specified for multiple
                                    1685             =*              removes, must not be specified for single remove)
                                    1686             =*     &FCOUNT  count of elements to be removed (shouldn't be
                                    1687             =*              specified for single remove)

                                    1697             =*********************************************************************

                                    2098     195.              AIF   ('&TYPE' EQ 'SYNC').OK,('&TYPE' EQ 'ASYNC').OK

1PAGESERV (PAGE00) (09:42) (22MAR04) PAGESERV - Local macros                                                                Page   14
0Loc    Object Code    Addr1 Addr2  Stmt Lv Lineno    Source Statement           (Hibal 5, Asmedit 3.3)  HLASM R4.0  2004/03/22 09.42

0                                   2118     215.              AIF   ('&TYPE' EQ 'SYNC').OK,('&TYPE' EQ 'ASYNC').OK
                                    2119     216.              MNOTE 8,'&TYPE is invalid, must be ASYNC or SYNC'
                                    2120     217.     .OK      ANOP  ,
                                    2121     218.              AIF   ('&TYPE' NE 'SYNC').AFLG
                                    2122     219.     &SYNC    SETB  1
                                    2123     220.     .AFLG    ANOP
                                    2124     221.     .*
                                    2125     222.              MNOTE *,'Restore old lock flags, free PCB lock, and enable'
                                    2126     223.     &COMPCB  SETC  '&CPCB'
                                    2127     224.     &L       DS    0H
                                    2128     225.              IC    &WR,PCBLOCKF
                                    2129     226.              MVC   PCBLOCKF,&FLG           Restore previous locks
                                    2130     227.              STC   &WR,&FLG
                                    2131     228.              IF    &FLG..PCBFGBL,BEGIN     Global lock held?
                                    2132     229.     .*
                                    2133     230.     .*  Get global PCB addressability
                                    2134     231.     .*
                                    2135     232.              AIF   ('&COMPCB' NE '').INREGAS
                                    2136     233.              L     RCPCB,PAGCASB
                                    2137     234.              WITH  (ASB,RCPCB),'L RCPCB,ASBPAGB'
                                    2138     235.     &COMPCB  SETC  'RCPCB'
                                    2139     236.     .*
                                    2140     237.     .*  Only use a WITH statement if the PCB does not have an active
                                    2141     238.     .*  using, or the using is with a register other than the one
                                    2142     239.     .*  specified
                                    2143     240.     .*
                                    2144     241.     .INREGAS $USLKUP ASBPCB
                                    2145     242.              AIF   (NOT &$OK).USEAS
                                    2146     243.     &USREG   SETA  &$REG#
                                    2147     244.              $RGLKUP &COMPCB
                                    2148     245.              AIF   (NOT &$OK).USEAS
                                    2149     246.              AIF   (&USREG NE &$REG#).USEAS
                                    2150     247.              LKREL PCBLOCK
                                    2151     248.              AGO   .NOUSEAS
                                    2152     249.     .USEAS   WITH  (ASBPCB,&COMPCB),'LKREL PCBLOCK' Free lock
                                    2153     250.     .NOUSEAS ANOP  ,
                                    2154     251.              END   ,                       OF Global lock held?
                                    2155     252.              IF    &FLG..PCBFLCL,BEGIN     Local lock held?
                                    2156     253.              LKREL PCBLOCK                 Free lock
                                    2157     254.              END   ,                       OF Local lock held?
                                    2158     255.              SSM   &MASK                   Reset the system mask - enable
                                    2159     256.              MEND  ,
0                                   2161     258.              MACRO
                                    2162     259.     &L       PAGAD &REG,&BEGIN             Get addr to PAG ctl block
                                    2163     260.              USING PZERO,R0
                                    2164     261.     &L       L     &REG,PZMATP
                                    2165     262.              DROP  R0
                                    2166     263.              WITH  (MAT,&REG),'L &REG,MATPAGCB'
                                    2167     264.              AIF   ('&BEGIN' NE 'BEGIN').NOBLK
                                    2168     265.              WITH  (PAGCB,&REG),BEGIN
                                    2169     266.              MEXIT ,
                                    2170     267.     .NOBLK   WITH  (PAGCB,&REG)
                                    2171     268.              MEND

0                                   2241     338.              MACRO
                                    2242     339.     &L       CELLGET &FAMT,&TYPE=
                                    2243     340.     .*  If &WAIT has the value YES/NO, then the wait flag will be
                                    2244     341.     .*  set or not for allocation.  If the value of &WAIT is anything
                                    2245     342.     .*  other than YES/NO, then that value is treated as a flag which
                                    2246     343.     .*  determines whether the wait parameter is set.
                                    2247     344.              LCLC  &T,&AMT
                                    2248     345.              AIF   ('&TYPE' NE 'PAGE').CHKSWP
                                    2249     346.     &T       SETC  'LA:PAGPGCEL'
                                    2250     347.              AGO   .DOCALL

0                                   3839     510.              COPY  PAGEPARM                PAGESERV's global interface
                                    3840             =*
                                    3841             =*  Page fault return codes
                                    3842             =*
                                    3843             =@PFRINP  EQU   0                       Fault in progress
                                    3844             =@PFRADDR EQU   4                       Addressing exception
                                    3845             =@PFROK   EQU   8                       Fault resolved
                                    3846             =@PFRWAIT EQU   12                      Must wait for some resource

0Loc    Object Code    Addr1 Addr2  Stmt Lv Lineno    Source Statement           (Hibal 5, Asmedit 3.3)  HLASM R4.0  2004/03/22 09.42
+___    ______ ____    _____ _____  ____ __ ______    ______ _________
0                                   5741     674.        
                                    5742     675.          A swapping control block is made up of nested DSECTS             
                                    5743     676.          - The lowest level is made up of the lists of real, and virtual  
                                    5744     677.            addresses, and segment numbers, history etc.                   
                                    5745     678.          - The next level is an extent, one or more of which describe an  
                                    5746     679.            address space's working set.                                   
                                    5747     680.          - The highest level contains internal work areas and the swap    
                                    5748     681.            parameters required for the external swap request.             
                                    5749     682.        
 000000                00000 00004  5750     683.     PGDSLIST RECORD BEGIN                  Element Real addr for swap
 000000                             5758  1  684.     PGDSLAD    DS    A                       Address
 PGDSLAD.PGDSLAX   80 ONES          5759  1  685.                FLAG  (PGDSLAX,PGDSLAD.X'80') | last in list
 000004                             5768  1  686.     PGDSLNXT   DS    0X
 000004                             5769  1  687.     PGDSLLOG   RECLOG ,                      Logarithm of record length
                                    5774  1 01-RECLO +PGDSLLOG   EQU   2,,C'N'
 000004                00004 00004  5775     688.              END   ,
0000000                00000 00008  5785     690.     PGDSVLST RECORD BEGIN                  Virtual addr list for swap
 000000                             5793  1  691.     PGDSVA     DS    A                       Address

                                    8673  5 1236.                      If the LRA indicates page invalid then the virtual            
                                    8674  5 1237.                    address lives in another page table, and that page table

                                    8676  5 1239.                      If a LRA on the virtual address of this page table

0                                   9869    1397.     
                                    9870    1398.                                                                          
                                    9871    1399.       Computes virtual segment/shadow-segment table                      
                                    9872    1400.        entry addresses and page/shadow-page table entry                  
                                    9873    1401.        addresses for a given virtual address and ASB                     
                                    9874    1402.       If the segment table is invalid, then the page/shadow-page table   
                                    9875    1403.        entry addresses are not provided.                                 
                                    9876    1404.

                                    9878    1406.                                                                          
                                    9879    1407.       Output - @VIRTABL                                                  
                                    9880    1408.           The stack area contains the virtual table addresses for        
                                    9881    1409.         the given virtual address.  Flags indicate whether or not        
                                    9882    1410.         the segment and page table entries are valid, and which          
                                    9883    1411.         address space locks have been obtained.

                                   10663    1524.     
                                   10664    1525.                                                                          
                                   10665    1526.       Resolve paged out page tables                                      
                                   10666    1527.         This routine brings in the page table for a given address, but   
                                   10667    1528.       doesn't bring in the actual page.  The page table is locked in     
                                   10668    1529.       main store.                                                        
                                   10669    1530.         The virtual addresses of the page and shadow page table          
                                   10670    1531.       addresses are set                                                  
                                   10671    1532.         Only for synchronous routines                                    
                                   10672    1533.

                                   10674    1535.                                                                          
                                   10675    1536.       Output - @RESPT                                                    
                                   10676    1537.                   RVR = contents of @PTRC                                
                                   10677    1538.                     0 = page table now in core                           
                                   10678    1539.                                                                          
                                   10679    1540.

                                   13723    1930.                                                                          
                                   13724    1931.       Page I/O termination                                               
                                   13725    1932.                                                                          
                                   13726    1933.        Input - @IOTERM                                                   
                                   13727    1934.            The PGDPAGE control block contains the PCB address that is    
                                   13728    1935.          in control of the I/O.  The owner of the frame in I/O is        
                                   13729    1936.          determined from the frame table entry.                          
                                   13730    1937.                                                                          
                                   13731    1938.       Output - NONE

0                                  13968    1965.     *   We need the local address space lock, and if this I/O is
                                   13969    1966.     *   for a global frame, we need the global address space lock.
                                   13970    1967.     *
                                   13971    1968.     *  NB - This logic would need to change if one address space could
                                   13972    1969.     *    fault in a secondary address space.  Currently the only
                                   13973    1970.     *    other address space one can fault in is the global address
                                   13974    1971.     *    space.

0                                  14458  1 2033.          
                                   14459  1 2034.             If we are supposed to release or unfix this frame at I/O      
                                   14460  1 2035.            completion, do it.                                             
                                   14461  1 2036.             If a frame is to be released, don't unfix it first, just      
                                   14462  1 2037.            relase it.  This needs to be done this way so that the lists   
                                   14463  1 2038.            of unfixed frames in the PCB do not change while a swap is in  
                                   14464  1 2039.            progress.  The long term fixed frames are allowed to change    
                                   14465  1 2040.            during this time however.                                      
                                   14466  1 2041.          
 000FCE 9110 301D      0001D       14467  1 2042.                IF    PFTFREL,BEGIN           Release frame

                                   19444    2787.                                                                          
                                   19445    2788.                                                                          
                                   19446    2789.                  Set up an address space to be swapped                   
                                   19447    2790.       Swap frames are put into the swap control block in a specific      
                                   19448    2791.       order.  Segment table frame(s), then page table frames, then       
                                   19449    2792.       other non-fixed frames.                                            
                                   19450    2793.                                                                          
                                   19451    2794.        Input -    @SETSWAP                                               
                                   19452    2795.                                                                          
                                   19453    2796.       Output -    @SSFLAG indicates success or failure of setup          
                                   19454    2797.                                                                          
                                   19455    2798.

 000008                            19466  1 2802.     #SSSLNXV   DS    A                       | and aux block
 00000C                            19467  1 2803.     #SSNXDB    DS    A                       Next descriptor block
                                   19468  1 2804.     #ADPARM    EQU   #SSDBAD,*-#SSDBAD
 000010                            19469  1 2805.     #SSCLAST   DS    A                       Last I/O cell address
 000014                            19470  1 2806.     #SSPSWM    DS    X                       PSW mask for disabling
 000015                            19471  1 2807.     #SSLKFLG   DS    X                       Locks for this PCB

                                   24159  1 3392.          
                                   24160  1 3393.            The frames of swapped out address spaces are controlled by the  
                                   24161  1 3394.            PAGSWAPL lock, and so therefore is the state of a swapped out   
                                   24162  1 3395.            address space.  (logically swapped, un-reclaimed frames etc)    
                                   24163  1 3396.            So we hold the lock when we decide if this AS is in or out.

                                   42149    5678.        Input - @PAGE                                                     
                                   42150    5679.                                                                          
                                   42151    5680.       Output - RVR =  0  Range of pages is now undefined                 
                                   42152    5681.                RVR <> 0  At least one page was undefined, had a          
                                   42153    5682.                          long-term fix on it, or did not match the       
                                   42154    5683.                          Local/Global flag of the ASB.                   
                                   42155    5684.                            In this case RVR contains the address of      
                                   42156    5685.                          the page which could not be undefined. The      
                                   42157    5686.                          rest of the pages in the range are ignored.

                                   45057  2 6001.       the virtual addresses of the page table is for a page table.       
                                   45058  2 6002.         Then the page table is initialized to all undefined pages.

0                                  52454    6970.     
                                   52455    6971.                                                                          
                                   52456    6972.       Allocate one or more page frames                                   
                                   52457    6973.                                                                          
                                   52458    6974.        Input - @FRAMGET                                                  
                                   52459    6975.                                                                          
                                   52460    6976.       Output - @FRAMGET and RVR                                          
                                   52461    6977.                  RVR contains the real address of the frame              
                                   52462    6978.                  For synchronous operations the procedure does not       
                                   52463    6979.                return until the required number of frames are            
                                   52464    6980.                allocated.                                                
                                   52465    6981.                  For asynchronous operations the procedure will return   
                                   52466    6982.                with @FRAOK set if the allocation was successful.         
                                   52467    6983.                                                                          
                                   52468    6984.                                                                          
                                                      
0000000                00000 0001E 52469    6985.     #FRAMEGET RECORD BEGIN
                                   52477  1 6986.     #FGLIST    LHEAD PFX=#FG                 Temp frame list
                                   52478  1 01-LHEAD +#FGLIST    EQU   *,12,C'N'
 000000                            52479  1 01-LHEAD +#FGFP      DS    A                       Forward pointer
 000004                            52480  1 01-LHEAD +#FGBP      DS    A                       Backward pointer
 000008                            52481  1 01-LHEAD +#FGCNT     DS    A                       Number of elements in list

+___    ______ ____    _____ _____  ____ __ ______    ______ _________
0                                  61603    8196.        
                                   61604    8197.            Free locks before we wait                                     
                                   61605    8198.          Spin locks can be obtained more than once by a task.  Before    
                                   61606    8199.          a task can wait, it must be free of all spin locks.  Therefore  
                                   61607    8200.          this routine calls the lock release routine until the return    
                                   61608    8201.          indicates that the lock is completely free (RVR=0).  When this  
                                   61609    8202.          task is resumed, this routine will obtain the locks such that   
                                   61610    8203.          the lock is in the same condition as on entry to this routine.  
                                   61611    8204.        
 0074A8 5830 C04C            00004 61612    8205.              L     RB,@WTLOCK
 0074AC 1233/4780 A05E       074BC 61613    8206.              IF    (RB,~ZERO),BEGIN        Free specific lock

 0074BC                            61656    8208.              END   ,                       OF Free specific lock
